page.title: 04Walks in Stewards Copse
page.content: {May.}We saw bluebells, wood garlic, dead nettles, stitchwort, celandine, red campion and cow parsley growing in the wood. We saw oak flowers and two baby squirrels playing in the oak tree. There were big fences at the end of each garden to stop deer from jumping over and damaging the plants. We sowed our peas in Mrs. Carter's garden. {July 12th.}We walked to Priory farm and looked at the barn where there are remains of a Priory in the wood there was once a road leading to the Ford where people could cross the river. We saw wild roses, woundwort, thistles, hedgebedstraw, blackberry blossom, chestnut flowers and hazel nuts on our walk. We picked our peas in Mrs. Carter's garden. (This was a class of 5 year olds from Arundel CE School)
